intro: Carex iynx, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces three-sided, cylindrical stems. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
